title: How to Make Anise Tea

steps.headline: Boil the kettle.
steps.description: Place 1 teaspoon of dried anise leaf or 3 teaspoons of fresh, crushed anise leaf or leaves into one cup of boiling water.

steps.headline: Allow to steep for a few minutes.
steps.description: It is now ready to serve.

steps.headline: Crush or grind 1 tablespoon of anise seeds.
steps.description: A mortar and pestle is a good instrument for this purpose.

steps.headline: Add 2 cups of boiling water to a saucepan.
steps.description: Add the crushed seeds. Simmer gently for 5 to minutes.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: It is now ready to serve as it is. However, you may wish to add milk, as with ordinary tea.seeds:

steps.headline: Crush the anise seeds if you haven’t done so already.
steps.description: This releases their fragrant oils and makes certain that the tea will taste marvelous.

steps.headline: Place the crushed anise seeds into the intended mug or cup.
Pour the boiling water into the cup.
Allow to steep for 10 to 15 minutes.
steps.description: Yes, the tea will cool but the flavor depth will benefit greatly from a long steeping time. Once it is has steeped sufficiently, it is ready to serve.
